title: The Rechabites' Obedience
shortSummary: Jeremiah 35 recounts God's command to Jeremiah to bring the Rechabites before Him and offer them wine, which they refuse in obedience to their ancestor Jonadab's command. Their faithfulness contrasts sharply with Judah's disobedience to God's commands, serving as a solemn warning and a promise of God's enduring covenant with the faithful.
timeline: c. 608-598 BC - Reign of Jehoiakim, King of Judah, shortly before the Babylonian exile

keyCharacters.name: Jeremiah
keyCharacters.description: The prophet of God who delivers God's message to the Rechabites and the people of Judah.

keyCharacters.name: Jonadab (Jehonadab) son of Rechab
keyCharacters.description: Ancestor of the Rechabites who commanded his descendants to abstain from wine and live in tents, setting a pattern of obedience.

keyCharacters.name: Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah
keyCharacters.description: A leader among the Rechabites who, along with his brethren and sons, is brought before the LORD by Jeremiah.

keyCharacters.name: Jehoiakim
keyCharacters.description: King of Judah during whose reign the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.

definitions.definition: A nomadic clan descended from Jonadab son of Rechab, known for their strict obedience to his commands, including abstaining from wine and living in tents.

definitions.term: Chamber of the sons of Hanan
definitions.definition: A specific room within the temple complex where the Rechabites were brought, indicating a place of significance for God's presence and prophetic activity.
An alcoholic beverage; here it symbolizes temptation and disobedience, which the Rechabites refuse to partake in as a sign of faithfulness.
God’s messengers sent to call Israel and Judah to repentance and obedience to God's covenant.

outline.heading: God’s Command to Jeremiah Regarding the Rechabites
outline.description: God instructs Jeremiah to bring the Rechabites into the temple and offer them wine to test their obedience, setting the stage for a demonstration of faithfulness.

outline.heading: The Rechabites’ Obedience to Jonadab’s Command
outline.description: The Rechabites refuse the wine, explaining their lifelong obedience to Jonadab’s commands to abstain from wine, build houses, or sow seed, living as nomads in tents.

outline.heading: God’s Message of Rebuke to Judah
outline.description: God contrasts the Rechabites’ obedience with Judah’s persistent disobedience despite prophetic warnings, declaring impending judgment because of their refusal to listen.

outline.heading: God’s Promise to the Rechabites
outline.description: Because of their faithfulness, God promises that Jonadab’s descendants will always have a representative standing before Him, affirming divine reward for obedience.

application: Obedience to God’s commands, even when difficult or countercultural, honors Him and sets believers apart as faithful witnesses.
God uses the example of others’ faithfulness to convict and challenge His people to repent and return to Him.
Consistent faithfulness in small matters reflects a heart aligned with God’s will and can result in lasting spiritual blessings.
Believers should heed God’s warnings through His Word and His messengers, responding with repentance rather than stubbornness.

keyVerses.text: But they said, We will drink no wine: for Jonadab the son of Rechab our father commanded us, saying, Ye shall drink no wine, neither ye, nor your sons for ever:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the Rechabites’ unwavering obedience to their ancestor’s command, symbolizing faithfulness and self-discipline.

keyVerses.text: The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, that he commanded his sons not to drink wine, are performed; for unto this day they drink none, but obey their father's commandment: notwithstanding I have spoken unto you, rising early and speaking; but ye hearkened not unto me.
keyVerses.significance: God contrasts the Rechabites’ obedience with Judah’s disobedience, underscoring the seriousness of rejecting God’s word.

keyVerses.text: Therefore thus saith the LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring upon Judah and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them: because I have spoken unto them, but they have not heard; and I have called unto them, but they have not answered.
keyVerses.significance: This verse pronounces the judgment that results from persistent rejection of God’s warnings, emphasizing the consequences of disobedience.

keyVerses.text: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not want a man to stand before me for ever.
keyVerses.significance: God’s promise of an enduring legacy for the faithful Rechabites illustrates divine reward for obedience and faithfulness.
